page.title: 14HOCKWOLD OF OLD
page.content: The 2 villages of Hockwold and Wilton have now grown together. The 2 churches, under the patronage of Caius and Gonville College, are over 300 yrs old. The main street follows the route of an ancient sheep walk. Devil's Dyke an old fortification crosses north to south across the section. The Black Death{Plague}was brought to the village by traders, via the river. There are a few thatched and listed houses of character. Legend tells of { {selling wives}by auction on the Cross Hill, and a secret tunnel to St.Peter's Church. The village sign includes{hare coursing}which is still held today. Several inhabitants emigrated to Canada in l912 after a disastrous flood. The RAF & Household Cavalry have utilised the area for training in both World Wars.
